1.q_string: There is no change in the volume of a wire due to the change in its length on stretching. The Poisson's ratio of material of wire is
The increase in the length of a wire on stretching is 0.025%. If its Poisson's ratio is 0.4, then the percentage decrease in the diameter is :
Two wires of the same length and made of the same material, but having radii in the ratio 1 : 2 are stretched by two unequal forces to produce equal elongation. What is the ratio of the two forces?
An increase in pressure required to decreases the \(200\) litres volume of a liquid by \(0.004 \%\) in the container is: (Bulk modulus of the liquid \(=2100 \mathrm{MPa}\) ).
A wire can be broken by applying load of 200N. The force required to break another wire of the same length and same material, but double in diameter is:
A wire elongates by l mm when a load W is hanged from it. If the wire goes over a pulley and two weights W each are hung at the two ends, the elongtion is:

A body of mass \(10 \mathrm{~kg}\) is attached to a wire \(0.3 \mathrm{~m}\) long. Its breaking stress is \(4.8 \times 10^{7}\) \(\mathrm{N} / \mathrm{m}^{2}\). The area of cross section of the wire is \(10^{-6} \mathrm{~m}^{2}\). The maximum angular velocity with which it can be rotated in a horizontal circle without breaking is:

A steel wire of cross-sectional area \(3 \times 10^{-6} \mathrm{~m}^{2}\) can bear a maximum strain of \(10^{-3}\). Young's modulus of steel is \(2 \times 10^{11} \mathrm{~N} / \mathrm{m}^{2}\). The maximum mass this wire can hold is:

A student performs an experiment to determine the Young's modulus of a wire, exactly \(2 \mathrm{~m}\) long, by Searle's method. In a particular reading, the student measures the extension in the length of the wire to be \(0.8 \mathrm{~mm}\) with an uncertainty of \(0.05 \mathrm{~mm}\) at a load of exactly \(1.0 \mathrm{~kg}\). The student also measures the diameter of the wire to be \(0.4 \mathrm{~mm}\) with an uncertainty of \(0.01 \mathrm{~mm}\). Take \(g=9.8 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}\) (exact). The Young's modulus obtained from the reading is:
